itemDescription: English soldier, recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: Major William Mordaunt Marsh Edwards,  (7 May 1855 – 17 September 1912) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |William Mordaunt Marsh Edwards || British Army || 1882 || Anglo-Egyptian War || Tel-el-Kebir
